title: Authors and Citation
text: Nguyen K, Truong K, Cao H, Ng S (2023). group03package: Package (One Line, Title Case). R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {group03package: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {Kaylie Nguyen and Karlie Truong and Hanzhang Cao and Ser Jie Ng},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal group03package provide functions run analysis project DSCI 310 smoothly. include loading data, computing averages numeric variables plotting histograms EDA, converting character columns factor building knn model.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version group03package GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: use package, first load package: beginning project, ’s necessary load relevant dataset. function load_data() take csv file, column names, separator csv file, well string specifying handle NAs values. Default arguments given separator na_values. Sometimes, also need convert specific string values column dataframe another string model, ’s sub_values() comes handy. example: function replace rows value “setasa” column “Species” iris dataframe new string “replaced_Setosa.” Another function package avg_numeric() group rows dataframe according specified categorical column passed function argument, compute average numeric attributes category output summary table. example, function group observations iris dataset based “Species” calculate mean numeric attributes species. package also include function plot_hist() allows easier plotting histogram categorical attributes dataframe. Please see function file plot_hist.R parameters customize plot. Finally, function build_model() perform cross validation knn model fitted given dataset using given recipe, taking argument whether optimize number neighbors k, return fitted knn model. Usage function follow: function parameters can found build_model.R
code: library(group03package) load_data(path, names, separator = ",", na_values = "NAs") sub_values(iris, Species, 'replaced_Setosa', 'setosa') avg_numeric(iris,Species) build_model <- function(training_set, recipe, optimal, vfold, gridvals, k)

title: Building model — build_model

title: Building model — build_model
code: build_model(training_set, recipe, optimal, vfold, gridvals, k)

title: Building model — build_model
text: training_set dataframe containing data train model recipe recipe prepare data modelling optimal variable takes string "None" "Yes" specify whether use tune() neighbors("None" optimal yet) use existing number optimal k vfold dataframe containing data splitted folds cross validation gridvals tibble containing values k tuning k Additional numeric argument, take integer indicate number optimal neighbors model

title: Building model — build_model
text: fitted knn model

title: Building model — build_model
code: if (FALSE) { image_recipe <- recipes::recipe(Species ~ ., data = iris) |>   recipes::step_scale(all_predictors()) |>   recipes::step_center(all_predictors())   build_model(iris, image_recipe, "Yes", k = 10) }

title: Tidy eval helpers — tidyeval
text: page lists tidy eval tools reexported package rlang. learn using tidy eval scripts packages high level, see dplyr programming vignette ggplot2 packages vignette. Metaprogramming section Advanced R may also useful deeper dive. tidy eval operators {{, !!, !!! syntactic constructs specially interpreted tidy eval functions. mostly need {{, !! !!! advanced operators use simple cases. curly-curly operator {{ allows tunnel data-variables passed function arguments inside tidy eval functions. {{ designed individual arguments. pass multiple arguments contained dots, use ... normal way.   enquo() enquos() delay execution one several function arguments. former returns single expression, latter returns list expressions. defused, expressions longer evaluate . must injected back evaluation context !! (single expression) !!! (list expressions).   simple case, code equivalent usage {{ ... . Defusing enquo() enquos() needed complex cases, instance need inspect modify expressions way. .data pronoun object represents current slice data. variable name string, use .data pronoun subset variable [[.   Another tidy eval operator :=. makes possible use glue curly-curly syntax LHS =. technical reasons, R language support complex expressions left =, use := workaround.   Many tidy eval functions like dplyr::mutate() dplyr::summarise() give automatic name unnamed inputs. need create sort automatic names , use as_label(). instance, glue-tunnelling syntax can reproduced manually :   Expressions defused enquo() (tunnelled {{) need simple column names, can arbitrarily complex. as_label() handles cases gracefully. code assumes simple column name, use as_name() instead. safer throws error input name expected.
code: my_function <- function(data, var, ...) {    data |>      group_by(...) |>      summarise(mean = mean({{ var }}))  } my_function <- function(data, var, ...) {    # Defuse    var <- enquo(var)    dots <- enquos(...)      # Inject    data |>      group_by(!!!dots) |>      summarise(mean = mean(!!var))  } my_var <- "disp"  mtcars |> summarise(mean = mean(.data[[my_var]])) my_function <- function(data, var, suffix = "foo") {    # Use `{{` to tunnel function arguments and the usual glue    # operator `{` to interpolate plain strings.    data|>      summarise("{{ var }}_mean_{suffix}" := mean({{ var }}))  } my_function <- function(data, var, suffix = "foo") {    var <- enquo(var)    prefix <- as_label(var)    data|>      summarise("{prefix}_mean_{suffix}" := mean(!!var))  }
